results.title: All you have to do is dig
results.brief_description: Throughout the year “fossickers” fill the mining towns of Coober Pedy, Andamooka and Lightning Ridge in Central Australia, searching for opals to make their fortune. The professional miners with their bizarre mining machinery, the casual people and the “noodlers” - weekend searchers.

results.title: All Writing Is a Process
results.brief_description: The recognition that all writing is a process is at the heart of contemporary teaching of writing. Covers such areas as: How do we help students to learn how to learn? How do we gauge progress? What role do computers have? What about grammar, spelling, punctuation? How can you conference everyone at once? Presented by Peta Heywood and Helen Bernes.

results.title: All under heaven: life in a chinese village (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton, Dan Sape, Kathy Kline and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
An intimate look at daily life in Long Bow - a village 600 kilometres south-west of Beijing. Ancient traditions persist - we see an elaborate funeral, a country fair, a local animal market and an open air opera. But changes have come to Long Bow, with the shift from collective to individual farming. A sense of dramatic change accompanies the simple rhythms of rural life. Part one of The Long Bow trilogy.

results.title: All under heaven: life in a chinese village
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton, Don Sape, Kathy Kline and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
An intimate look at daily life in Long Bow, a village 600 kilometres south-west of Beijing in Northern China. Ancient traditions persist - we see an elaborate funeral, a country fair, a local animal market and an open air opera. Documents the changes that have come to Long Bow with the shift from collective to individual farming.

results.title: All the World's a Stage
results.brief_description: Follows the progress of three students from their auditions before John Houseman for the Drama Division at the famous Juilliard School for performing arts, through to rigorous training to become professional actors.

results.title: All the way up there
results.creator_credit: Valhalla Film Productions, Warrick Attewell and Gaylene Preston
results.brief_description: Bruce Burgess, a 24 year-old cerebral palsy victim, realises an impossible dream - to climb a mountain. He manages to achieve this with the help of Graeme Dingle, one of New Zealand’s best known mountaineers. Emphasises the need for individual self-fulfilment despite physical or other limitations Narrated by David Yerix.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Valhalla Film Productions, Warrick Attewell and Gaylene Preston

results.title: All the steaks
results.creator_credit: Meat and Livestock Australia and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Meat makes the meal”.
Barbara Lynch, home economist for the Australian Meat Board discusses meat and shows the different cuts of steaks and how to butcher them. No other credits available.

results.title: All The Same
results.brief_description: Asylum seeker Mostafa Azimitabar, know as ‘Moz’ shot and released the music video for his song ‘All The Same’ from inside the Manus Island detention centre via a mobile phone.

constellations_other.name: Seeking asylum
constellations_other.description: Chauka Please Tell Us the Time was covertly filmed on a smartphone inside the Manus Island Detention Centre and sent via WhatsApp.
